lenders.name: Peter Lennon
lenders.loan_because:
Although I have not yet reached the position I want to be in my life I am well aware of how much better off I am than others. 
“Any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in Mankind; And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls; it tolls for thee.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a direct Fundraiser for the RSPB; a former multi-site retail manager, teacher and trainer with direct sales experience. I am looking to find a training role ideally in a charity in the north east of England. I have a particular concern for the welfare and rights of women and girls having been appalled at how badly females are treated in many areas.

lenders.name: Robin B Palmer
lenders.occupation: President and Owner, My Successables, Inc.
lenders.loan_because: I believe in KIVA!
lenders.occupational_info:
Hi! I starred in Broadway musicals for 15 years as Robin Boudreau, (my maiden name), & invented My Wake UP Call® Motivational Alarm Clock® Messages and My Good Night Messages™ - 100 hours & 20 product lines of patented five-minute messages with HH the Dalai Lama, Chicken Soup for the Soul’s Jack Canfield and Marci Shimoff, The Secret’s Dr. Joe Vitale, and other renowned experts, which bookend your day with inspiration to live the life of your dreams, instead of with blaring buzzers or negative news.    
Now licensing partners with Audible, (an Amazon company), My Wake UP Calls® and My Good Night Messages™ download to all Smartphones, Tablets, and iPods, and are available as Apps and on CDs. (Process Patent #8,064,295)

lenders.name: Sundog
lenders.loan_because:
"The Little Boy and the Starfish"

One fine warm day, an old man was walking down a sandy, tropical beach. He noticed as he was walking that the tide had brought in a lot of starfish. He started looking at the starfish and admiring their pretty colors as he walked.

He noticed a little boy in the distance was walking towards him, but at a very slow pace.

The reason for the slow pace of the little boy became apparent the closer the old man came. The little boy was also looking at the starfish, but he was doing more. He was picking up those he found and throwing them back out to sea.

"Why are you throwing the starfish back into the sea?" asked the old man. "Starfish die if they're out of their sea water for too long." replied the little boy.

Ever the practical man, he said, "It's a good thing to do, but do you know how many starfish there must be washed up on this beach every day? You can't possibly make a dent in that. What difference can you make in an effort to save starfish?"

The little boy bent down, picked up another starfish, threw it out into the sea, turned towards the old man, and said, "It made a difference to that one."
lenders.occupational_info: Microcredit, or small loans to the world's poorest people, is booming and now benefits more than half a billion people, a survey said yesterday (Dec. 18/07), but Africa and Latin America lag behind Asia and unscrupulous lenders are cashing in. The Microcredit Summit Campaign (http://www.microcreditsummit.org/) surveyed more than 3,000 microcredit bodies around the world, from small banks to community groups, and found they reported reaching 133 million people by the end of 2006, 92 million of them earning less than a dollar a day.

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because: I want to help.

lenders.name: Stephanie
lenders.loan_because: the people I have met throughout my travels have changed my life.  They have taught me to appreciate all that I have, while also educating me on the differences one individual can make.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with adolescents in a public secondary school, where I teach them the French language.  I enjoy being able to enrich my students' lives by introducing them to a different culture.  I love the look on their faces when they overcome a personal challenge, whether in or out of the classroom.  It makes all the long hours and hard work worthwhile.

lenders.name: Ruth
lenders.loan_because: I hope to help some one in need, in some small way.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with people who have suffered a brain injury and are having trouble talking, swallowing  or remembering.

lenders.name: Sybil
lenders.loan_because: I want to empower people.

lenders.name: Adrian
lenders.loan_because: I think everyone who is able to should do this.  There is such an enormous gap between the "haves" and the "have nots", we have to do what we can to help them.  It is a matter of literal survival in many cases.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a large office and am on the computer all day every day.  I have done this for many years and I enjoy it.  I also have a small business on the side selling rubber stamps and paper crafts.

lenders.name: Omar
lenders.loan_because: Because i want to help the people in need.
lenders.occupational_info: Long hours but i love what i do plus i am good at it.

lenders.name: Rebecca
lenders.loan_because: I think everyone deserves an opportunity to make a living for themselves and their families.  It's harder in some places to get that chance, so it's nice to provide for those who need a hand.

lenders.name: Donald & Marsha
lenders.loan_because: I was a U.S. Marine in Viet Nam (1967-1968), I realized how the "people" of Vietnam struggled for the last 200 yrs. just to be able to exist. This is my way of  helping someone that deserves to live a full life.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired

lenders.name: Marie
lenders.loan_because: I loan because Kiva is a brilliant organization, and although I don't have large amounts of money to loan it allows me to feel like I can still help someone worlds away from me.  I also love being able to follow up on the progress of the business and person that I'm trying to help.

lenders.name: Melissa
lenders.loan_because: Prior to my injury, I received an MBA in entrepreneurship, and value the autonomy and excitement of having one's own business and being one's own boss, particularly small or family-owned businesses, that may grow and develop into large corporations.  Additionally, I am intrigued by entrepreneurs who are self-made, come from little means and have a creative vision, and further, find the drive and focus to actually execute on their vision enough to support their families, despite the odds being against them.  It is highly impressive and I support and respect these entrepreneurs on the Kiva website, who are taking charge and have the initiative to make their goals and dreams come true, and I am very happy to help enable them on their journey in some small way financially.

lenders.name: Ann
lenders.loan_because: I have plenty and I would like to see others have prosperity also.

lenders.name: Warren
lenders.loan_because: it feels good.

lenders.loan_because:
We loan because many of us at the CMDPi know what it is like to have great ideas, but no one to help us make them a reality. 

Many of us where told that our ideas where a waste of time and would never amount to anything- we are proving them wrong....and we want to help other people prove their critics wrong as well....we are here to help!

lenders.name: Alison
lenders.loan_because: It is a way of making a difference

lenders.name: Deb
lenders.loan_because: In 2001-02 I was a volunteer in Mombasa, Kenya, and every day I saw a disabled man pedalling a rickety homemade cart across a treacherous crossroads with his hands. He was a cobbler and worked on a street corner. I was overwhelmed by his determination and tenacity. Around that time he received a microcredit loan and later I saw him featured on a TV documentary, talking with pride about being better able to provide for his family despite being unable to walk. That's when I stopped putting it off and found Kiva. We all share the same planet, how can we afford not to help each other?!
lenders.occupational_info: I work in language teaching and conservation - helping to protect the reef & rainforest in north east Australia and find a balance between use and non-use.

* I have been where some of them are financially...
* It takes so little to help 
* There is ALWAYS someone more in need than I am
* Makes you feel good to do good
* Do unto others what you would have done to / for you
*Why Not?
lenders.occupational_info:
Tour Bus driving in the summer, temporary [City] Borough Bus driving now, hopefully to become full time in the future.

I have 5 sons.   As sole support for the boys, money has always been an issue.  First husband died, 2nd owes over $75,000 child support.  I opened a children's clothing shop w/ very little money years ago, it got us through.  Work towards your dreams, have faith in yourself , pray and don't give up.   :  )

I can only hope that my loan helps to alleviate some of that misery by giving hard working people a chance to succeed.
